creditline: Gift of Ruth and Bruce Dayton
department: Chinese, South and Southeast Asian Art
description: spherical form with gimbals in center arranged to keep central cup upright; decorated with openwork design of butterfiles in scrolling flowers and foliage
markings: dealer\'s stickers, on interior of cover
text: This delicate silvered bronze sphere is designed to be carried by Buddhist or Taoist priests during ritual ceremonies. The interior is structured with a gimbel mechanism that, acting like a gyroscope, keeps the incense pot inside level and upright as the censor is swung about during ceremonies. The decoration consists of butterflies and chrysanthemums amongst a tendril pattern.
title: Censer
